snippet: Though around 10,000 schools can support student visas, not all are accredited in the states where they do business, the government has found.
abstract: Report released by the Government Accountability Office states that more than one-third of the flight schools in the United States that cater to foreigners are not certified by the Federal Aviation Administration, raising concerns that the schools are illegally backing student visas although they have no intention of teaching the students to fly.
lead_paragraph: Though around 10,000 schools can support student visas, not all are accredited in the states where they do business, the government has found.
